critique: The document reflects President Franklin D. Roosevelt's approval of a Code of Fair Competition for the Waterproofing, Dampproofing, Calking Compounds, and Concrete Floor Treatments Manufacturing Industry under the National Industrial Recovery Act of 1933. This act was a key component of the New Deal, which aimed to address the economic crisis of the Great Depression through government intervention and regulation. The document signifies a strong role for the federal government in regulating industry and promoting economic recovery.
